thread.title: Trott Bags More Euro Gold In Switzerland
thread.title_full: Trott Bags More Euro Gold In Switzerland

title: Trott Bags More Euro Gold In Switzerland
text:
Trott Bags More Euro Gold In Switzerland 10:06,   Share by email Laura Trott bagged her second gold medal of the European Track Championships in Switzerland after winning the scratch race with ease and style. 
The 23-year had already been a member of the victorious women's pursuit team and produced a superb performance in Grenchen to secure another gold. 
The race took place over 40 laps of the track and Trott took her time, as she was using the race as preparation for the omnium. 
However, she produced a superb final lap to storm past her rivals and come home ahead of Holland's Kirsten Wild and Roxanne Fournier of France. 
Trott said: "We were using it as a bit of tester for Saturday really because, obviously, the scratch race is the first race of the omnium, so it was a bit of an activation. 
"I'd normally do a turbo session on the day between the team pursuit and the omnium. As it was a scratch race and only 40 laps we thought why not, I'll just do it, and I just didn't panic, I guess. 
"It was like that little break went away and everyone was looking at me to work and I was like, 'I don't need to work, this isn't my race to lose'." Promoted Stories
